Articles.Content:
A while back (I think I was in 5th or 6th grade) I remember having an app called KSP Delta-V calculator, which let you select what parts made up your rocket and it would tell you where you could go. That app has long since vanished and I can’t find a similar tool. I know the game has a built-in Delta-V readout but sometimes it’s inaccurate and installing mods (specifically Kerberos Engineer Redux) opens the gate to bugs. Is there some form of online tool that lets you view the list of parts and design a craft?

In my mind it would be similar to a CAD program like LeoCAD where you get a list of everything and you can drag them into an editor.

I would understand if something this niche doesn’t exist, but I’m just checking to see.

The "Where Can I Go?" mod still works with KSP 1.12. It shows what planets you can reach while you're constructing your rocket. If you've already flying in low orbit it will estimate which bodies you can reach.

If you want to use no mods, find a delta-V map (linked below for stock, and many planet packs such as JNSQ and KSRSS include their own PDF maps) and do your own calculations based on what the VAB readout shows. For a rough estimate, use sea level dV for the 1st stage then add vacuum dV for additional stages to get your total dV.

I'll further add that the more you become skilled, the less those tools are useful. gravity assists will make a world of difference in where you can actually go. I haven't looked at a deltaV map in a year
